description: Extension to existing basement (incorporating front lightwells); part single, part two storey rear extensions (following demolition of existing rear additions); rear roof extensions (involving conversion of roofspace to habitable use) and associated internal and external alterations to accommodate conversion of existing single family dwellinghouse into 7 no. self-contained residential units (6x1 bed and 1x3 bed) with associated private and communal amenity space, cycle parking and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers:  16-017-E02 (Existing site plan); 16-017-E03 (Existing basement floor plan); 16-017-E04 (Existing ground floor plan); 16-017-E05 (Existing first floor plan); 16-017-E06 (Existing second floor plan); 16-017-E07 (Existing roof plan); 16-017-E08 (Existing front elevation, north facing); 16-017-E09 (Existing rear elevation, north facing); 16-017-E10 (Existing section A-A); 16-017-P111 Rev B (proposed site plan); 16-017-P112 Rev B (proposed basement floor plan); 16-017-P113 Rev B (proposed ground floor plan); 16-017-P114 Rev B (proposed first floor plan); 16-017-P115 Rev B (proposed second floor plan); 16-017-P116 (proposed roof floor); 16-017-P200 (proposed front elevation); 16-017-P201 Rev B (proposed rear elevation); 16-017-P300A Rev A (proposed section A-A)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those indicated in the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed front roof lights shall be of the non-projecting Conservation Area type and shall be installed flush with the plane of the roof and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring a high quality of design that preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the Haven Green Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| Prior to first occupation of the new house, an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be installed and thereafter permanently retained

Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016). | Flats 1 and 2 at ground floor level hereby approved shall provide access in accordance with Building Regulations M4(2)

Reason: To ensure the development can provide social inclusion flexibility for the accessibility of future occupiers and their changing needs over time, in accordance with the requirements of Policy 3.5 of the London Plan (2016) | The proposed hard and soft landscaping layout to the front and rear of the development hereby approved shall be carried out as shown on the approved plans prior to occupation of the development. Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason : To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Building envelope insultation for the approved residential building shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o Â Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| A Construction Management Plan in relation to the proposed basement development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to implementation. The plan shall include the following:
Details of construction hours;

Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014.
Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
Site security during construction;
Construction methods;
Site management and access;
Vehicle and machinery specifications;
Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries;
Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| On occupation, the approved secure cycle storage enclosures as shown on the approved plans to hold thirteen (13) cycles shall be implemented and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policies 6.13, 6.9 and table 6.3 | Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted within discreet storage  and retained permanently in accordance with the location details approved under Condition 2 of this permission.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).
